Responsabilita' di studi e ricerche scie.content: collaborazioni con Center for Research on Pensions and Welfare Policies (CeRP) in tema di pensioni ed invecchiamento della popolazione (si riporta lettera riassuntiva dei contratti e il primo dei contratti stipulati con dettaglio delle tematiche di ricerca)
Ricerca per ISFOL sul tema "La normativa sul pensionamento e il dibattito sulla riforma: possibili riflessi su aspettative e comportamenti"
Ricerca affidata da EPASA-CNA sul tema "Le pensioni degli artigiani: un'analisi della situazione italiana e una comparazione a livello europeo"
Fondazione Collegio Carlo Alberto: collaborazione di ricerca sul tema "Le scelte di pensionamento dei lavoratori: estensione del modello Option Value"
Fondazione Collegio Carlo Alberto: collaborazione di ricerca sul tema "Le transizioni verso il pensionamento: vincoli, incentivi e scelte individuali"

Università degli Studi di Torino e Fondazione Collegio Carlo Alberto: collaborazione di ricerca sul tema "La mortalità differenziale per status socioeconomico e tipo di occupazione in Italia" ( 2 contratti stipulati con la Fondazione, 2 contratti stipulati con il Dipartimento di Economia dell' Università degli Studi di Torino)
Studi Fondazione Luigi Einaudi e Unicredit: "La finanza delle imprese del Nord Ovest: cosa cambiare per crescere" (capitoli 1 e 2)

Organizzazione o partecipazione come rel.content: fourth Annual conference of ‘International Social Security Administration’, Antwerp
Seventh workshop Marie Curie Research Training Network: ‘The Economics of Ageing’ joint with ‘Economics and Health Determinants of Retirement Behaviour NIA-P01’, University of Venice
Third Italian Congress of Econometrics and Empirical Economics, CIDE Conference, Ancona
‘ESPE 2010’, European Society of Population Economics conference, Essen
Fourth Italian Congress of Econometrics and Empirical Economics’, CIDE Conference, Pisa
NETSPAR International pension workshop, Collegio Carlo Alberto, Moncalieri
‘ALP-POP 2012’, The Alpine Population Conference, La Thuile
CeRP Conference, Financial Literacy, Saving and Retirement in an Ageing Society, Moncalieri
Fifth Italian Congress of Econometrics and Empirical Economics, CIDE Conference, Genova
Ifo / CESifo & University of Munich & MEA Conference on “Empirical Health Economics”, Munich
EALE conference, European Association of Labour Economists, Turin
‘ESPE 2015’, European Society of Population Economics conference, Izmir
SHARE conference: ‘Ageing in Europe – supporting policies for an inclusive society’, Brussels
NIDI/RUG conference: ‘Early life circumstances and late life outcomes’, The Hague
NIDI/RUG conference: ‘Socio-Economic Differences and Health Later in Life’, Groningen

Formale attribuzione di incarichi di ins.content: research fellowship Tinbergen Institute Amsterdam http://www.tinbergen.nl/ (in allegato quello che ho trovato, è passato molto tempo. Se avete bisogno di prove più formali, posso fare scrivere una dichiarazione dal direttore Prof. Marteen Lindeboom - o richiedere di effettuare una ricerca storica all'istituto)
Fellowship "Network for studies on Pensions, Ageing and Retirement (NETSPAR)"
Incarico di docenza: ‘Empirical Methods in Economics’, (lecturer) University of Groningen, Faculty of Economics and Business, dept. of Economics, Econometrics and Finance

Direzione o partecipazione alle attivit\.content: ‘Implications of demographic change in enlarged EU on patterns of saving and consumption and in related consumer’s behaviour’, FP7th EU Commission, DG Employment
‘Adequacy of Old Age Income Maintenance in the EU (AIM)’, FP6th EU Commission, DG Employment, Coordinator: Centre for European Policy Studies (CEPS)
‘Background information on flexibility in the age of retirement’, EU Commission, DG Employment
NETSPAR theme project, ‘Pensions, savings and retirement decisions II’, PI: R. Alessie and A. Kalwij
‘Aging, Labor Productivity and Sustainability of Public Pension Systems: an Investigation through Macro and Micro Modelling’, Regione Piemonte, Italy

‘Employment 2025: How will multiple transitions affect the European labour market’ (NEUJOBS), FP7th EU Commission, DG Employment, Coordinator: Centre for European Policy Studies (CEPS) (http://www.neujobs.eu/). CASE subcontracted to Collegio Carlo Alberto

‘Data Service Infrastructure for the Social Sciences and Humanities (DASISH)’, FP7th Collaborative Project, EU Commission, Coordinator: University of Gothenburg (http://dasish.eu/) (attached is proof of two conference participation)
PRIN 2010 The economic consequences of population ageing, Coordinator: A. Brugiavini
SHARE - Survey of Health, Ageing and Retirement in Europe (http://www.share-project.org/)

NETSPAR Large Vision project, ‘A Second and a Half Pillar for the Self-Employed?’, Coordinator: M. Mastrogiacomo (VU Amsterdam and Dutch National Bank) https://www.netspar.nl/en/project/a-seco nd-and-half-pillar-for-the-self-employed /
‘Synergies for Europe’s Research Infrastructure in the Social Sciences (SERISS), Horizon 2020, Coordinator: City University London. (http://seriss.eu/)
Centro Interuniversitario Cintia-Italy (https://cintia-italy.it/) - progetto "Social Security Wealth and Private Annuities in Europe: exploring Heterogeneity"

Conseguimento di premi e riconoscimenti.content: Center for Research on Pensions and Welfare Policies (CeRP – Collegio Carlo Alberto) research fellow (http://cerp.carloalberto.org/)
Tjalling Koopmans Research Institute, Utrecht University School of Economics visiting fellowship
Survey of Health and Retirement in Europe (SHARE) working group member (http://www.share-project.org/)
2013 Collegio Carlo Alberto Research Incentive Program award
RAND Corporation Labor and Population Summer Institute scholarship , Santa Monica, California (http://www.rand.org/labor/aging/rsi.html)

Integrating Expertise in Inclusive Growth (InGRID https://inclusivegrowth.be) transnational visiting grant (project: Health, Occupation, and the role of Measurement Error) https://inclusivegrowth.be/visiting-grants/
2015 Collegio Carlo Alberto Research Incentive Program award
